participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Nurturing and health-conscious, Emily is focused on creating a loving environment for her child. She tends to be optimistic yet sometimes anxious about new responsibilities.
participant_1.background: I love the way my nursery looks with my green crib and crib mobile. I grow my own vegetables and cook them myself. my parents are divorced. I'm more concerned with my health and the health of my children. I'm grateful to my parents for helping me out financially.

participant_2.name: Jason
participant_2.personality: Thoughtful and supportive, Jason is deeply invested in his relationships. He is creative and enjoys working on projects, but sometimes struggles with trust issues from past experiences.
participant_2.background: My spouse is a therapist who helps me work through my issues. I wake up early to feed my cats and then work on my laptops until it's time to get ready for my wedding in the park. i sleep in a princess bed. i have been cheated on by every ex girlfriend except for one. sometimes i volunteer at an urban farm.

content.text: Good, good. Just had a baby and getting ready to start my nursery.
Oh my goodness, congratulations! That's so exciting!
Thanks! I'm really excited but also nervous.
I'm sure you'll do great. It sounds like you're already on top of things!
I'm trying! My parents are divorced but they're both really helpful and supportive.
That's great to hear. I'm glad they're there for you.
I am too. It's really important to me to have a strong support system.
I agree. I'm really close with my parents and siblings.
That's awesome. I'm lucky to have a good relationship with my parents and siblings too.
